feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued November 22 at 2:41AM AKST until November 23 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON AKST THURSDAY... * WHAT...South winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. * WHERE...Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp. * WHEN...From 6 AM this morning to noon AKST Thursday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Eastern Alaska Range North of Trims Camp

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 21 at 4:32PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...LIGHT FREEZING RAIN POSSIBLE FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH EARLY THURSDAY MORNING... A weak front could bring light freezing rain and trace ice accumulations as it moves across Kuskokwim Delta late Wednesday into Thursday. Precipitation chances will be around 30-50% during this time.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 21 at 4:24PM AKST until November 23 at 1:00AM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM NOON WEDNESDAY TO 1 AM AKST THURSDAY FROM DILLINGHAM AND NORTH... * WHAT...Mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. * WHERE...Bristol Bay, from Dillingham north.

entry.title: Air Quality Alert issued November 21 at 1:32PM AKST by NWS
entry.summary: ...AIR QUALITY ALERT IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM AKST WEDNESDAY... The Department of Environmental Conservation has issued an Air Quality Alert which is IN EFFECT FROM 7 PM THIS EVENING TO 2 PM AKST WEDNESDAY. North Pole has a Stage 2 alert.

entry.summary: ...DIFFICULT TRAVEL CONDITIONS EXPECTED THURSDAY NIGHT... .Moderate to heavy snow will impact the northern Front Range foothills beginning Thanksgiving evening and continuing through Friday, with the heaviest snow occurring late Thursday evening and overnight. entry.cap:areaDesc: Larimer and Boulder Counties Between 6000 and 9000 Feet

entry.title: Flood Warning issued November 21 at 7:34PM EST until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The Saint Johns River at Astor is forecast to very slowly decline as heavy rainfall from upstream drains through the basin. Little change in levels in expected over the next several days. For the St. Johns River...including Astor...Minor flooding is

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued November 22 at 5:32AM EST by NWS
entry.summary: ...HAZARDOUS WINDS POSSIBLE ON AREA BRIDGES THIS MORNING... Gusty south to southwest winds will continue this morning ahead of an approaching cold front.
